website_summaries.verdict: This classic brand is still around for a reason. You'll need at least one strong hand to operate it, though.
pros: This jar opener provides leveraged twisting and spring-loaded power for smooth, easy operation
Can be hand washed when needed with warm water and a mild detergent, rinse and dry immediately
Fits any jar lid up to 4.5 inches
cons: Works best if you have at least one strong hand to use

customer_reviews.title: Good But Unfortable
customer_reviews.text: This is a great opener that works well for those with above-average hand strength and agility. The negatives are two. One is that the adjustment holes for various cap sizes are difficult to engage. The worst is that the total length of the device is way too short so it has the potential of hurting and damaging your palms on hard-to-open caps. Easier open caps work great.
customer_reviews.author: SIROCCO

customer_reviews.title: Not fancy but so practical
customer_reviews.text: The best jar opener so simple to use, very strong, just works. I have bought a bunch of these over the years and given them away to friends and family. every one i have given one to has been please with it. Yes they look old and strange but they work so well. Just place over the to of jar to open squeeze the handle until you here the lid pop up then twist off.
customer_reviews.author: St Helier Mark

customer_reviews.title: I hate this thing
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because a popular PBS cooking show gave it top marks, but I hate this thing. The lack handle slides up on the bar to fit tightly against the lid, then you squeeze the black handle up against the top slider bar and it clamps onto the lid. Then you turn it and in theory the lid pops open. NOT. It makes dents in the lid and it doesn't budge. Don't waste your money.
customer_reviews.author: Shire Dweller

customer_reviews.title: It works!
customer_reviews.text: Wonderful jar opener. My hands hurt all the time! This jar opener makes it easy to open jars and bottles, no matter what the size. I like it so much that I bought one for my sister and my sister-in-law!
customer_reviews.author: G. HOPKINS

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Easy Opener
customer_reviews.text: I've had this jar opener for 3 years now. Before then, I'd ordered other jar & bottle openers that people said were good for those of us with arthritic hands. This is the first one that's really worked for me. It's so easy! The hard part is figuring out how to use it the first time. Thereon, opening jars and bottles is a snap (with VERY few exceptions). I just looked at some of less enthusiastic reviews. All I can say is in the 3 years I've had this, my arthritic hands have continually worsened and I'm as much in love with this opener as when I first got it.
customer_reviews.author: Randi

customer_reviews.title: REALLY nice!
customer_reviews.text: Manual adjustment for the size of the lid you want to remove but that's easy. Then you grip the trigger and twist. I found it VERY easy to use and gives you lots of leverage. And also nice, it was top rated by a cooking show on public TV - that's how I found out about it. Expands to open lids from 1" to 4 5/8".
customer_reviews.author: Varley M.

customer_reviews.title: dents lids, hurts hand, slips, doesn't work
customer_reviews.text: I grew up with a Gilhoulli jar opener. It was amazing but they are a bit pricey, so I purchased this. Absolute junk. I need it to open the lids on my ball canning jars. It dents the lid, the metal of the handle digs into my hand, it slips half the time when trying to turn and scrapes the lid. I hate it. I'll be investing in my gilhoulli now.
customer_reviews.author: Glenn Pareira III

customer_reviews.title: BEST JAR OPENER in the WORLD!!
customer_reviews.text: Once you get the hang of using this thing, you'll never look at another opener ever. This thing expands to the WIDEST jars, and once you squeeze clamp it down, it releases the suction, making the "twist" motion a breeze to remove a lid. I bought these for a spare and a gift. NICE item.
customer_reviews.author: StarCastle

customer_reviews.title: Cheapest quality I have ever seen
customer_reviews.text: Hard to use-- the molded plastic just slides off when you try to use it-- nothing in the build says quality-- truly awful- not at all user friendly-- giving it a solid "do not buy" rating. The ratings above ask about "Thickness"-- have no idea what that means, well, the metal thickness is not substantial-- the fit of the parts and tolerances are just sloppy-- it makes it difficult to keep adjusted when you try to use this-- I do wonder if the original product that was copied -- must have had some craftsmanship ?
customer_reviews.author: JF

customer_reviews.title: Love the Swing-A-Way jar opener
customer_reviews.text: Love the Swing-A-Way jar opener! I ordered two one for me and one for my Mom as she has a lot of trouble opening jars because of arthritis in her hands. She Loves the Ease of use and Easy opening of jars she previously had to wait for me to visit to get open. The only thing I would change would be to add a rubber cover for the jar grips as they do mar the lid just a little bit when applying pressure but that is such a small concern. I would recommend this product to anyone with elderly parents or has issues with hand strength!
customer_reviews.author: ThymeX

customer_reviews.title: Don't use on lids you want to reuse.
customer_reviews.text: There are plenty of thorough reviews that are on the money, so I'll just add this: This opener leaves big dents in metal jar lids, so if you like to reuse your jars, this is not the opener for you. The lids will not reseal adequately. Don't get me wrong; I don't try to can in used jars. But I do store leftover soups and sauces in the fridge in them; also refrigerator pickles. I'll be looking for an alternative that doesn't ruin the lids.
customer_reviews.author: Peri Winkle

customer_reviews.title: I have one that is 30 years old. Didn't know you can still buy them. Gave it as a gift.
customer_reviews.text: My mom gave me one of these 30 years ago. It's one of the handiest things in the kitchen. It's never failed to open a jar. This edition is the same unit, but with a slightly ergonomic sleeve on the metal handle. Otherwise it seems identical to my cherished original one. Wanted to give one as a gift, looked over my unit, found the words "swing-a-way" and googled them. And here I am. It's a great gift to give.
customer_reviews.author: Conflicted Consumer

customer_reviews.title: Handle Your Jar
customer_reviews.text: Dang this is clever and works well. As my arthritis progresses, I find that I cannot get a good grip to open a pickle jar any more. I went all through my pitiful collection of jar openers and found some that were too small and others that were too large; none that were the right size. So, I tossed them all out. This has a ratcheting mechanism that instantly adjusts to the jar size so it gets the best grip. Chrome-plated steel with a padded vinyl handle grip. This will last. I liked it so well that I got one for my girlfriend; this ought to make me some Brownie points, for sure. I think you will be impressed.
customer_reviews.author: Sperrier

customer_reviews.title: No fuss, no muss, no plug, no batteries.
customer_reviews.text: I have 75 year old wrists and bones. Opening jars is an overwhelming task. I saw a video review of this jar opener and got one for myself. It works like a charm. No fuss, no muss, no straining. I know many people like those automatic openers but I'm happy with having a small gadget that stows away in a drawer with a small footprint. No plug ins. No batteries. It works. Mamma is happy.
customer_reviews.author: Miss Barbara

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: This makes opening jars so easy! My hands have not been strong enough to open jars for the past couple of years so I decided to give this product a try. I am very glad I did. It works really really well. It is adjustable and it can open a variety of sizes. In fact, since it arrived there has not been any size I needed that it could not open. Folds up nicely and does not take up very much space in my drawer. I wish I would’ve had this year’s ago.
customer_reviews.author: blackberry

customer_reviews.title: Handy
customer_reviews.text: I usually have problems trying to open jars myself. I was looking for something similar to what my parents have back home, but didn't know how to search for it (not sure what that doohickey was called). Anyways, came across this contraption and thought I'd give it a shot. It works fine, though it can take a few seconds to figure out how to get it to grip the jar properly as it's a loose kind of gripping mechanism. Handles all manner of sizes well. Solid performance and have no regrets buying this. Good value.
customer_reviews.author: Pensive at home

customer_reviews.title: Best jar opener on the market
customer_reviews.text: As I get a bit of age on me, my jar opening abilities are not what they once were. This is very similar to the jar opener I had growing up. It's super easy to use, and always manages to open whatever jar I have. I've tried other jar openers before finding this style was still available. The other ones were hit or miss. Definitely purchase this if you need a jar opener!
customer_reviews.author: skm526

customer_reviews.title: It Really Works
customer_reviews.text: I saw this product on Americas Test Kitchen, but most vendors wanted $20 but when I got a price drop notice to $10 I thought I would give it a try, and it really works! It feels a little cheap and flimsy but it clamps tight and twists the caps off with little effort, I think every kitchen should have one just like a can opener, why strain and struggle to open a jar when you don`t have to.
customer_reviews.author: Rick

customer_reviews.title: Neat little device
customer_reviews.text: I saw this gadget on Cook's Country on PBS and thought it was cool. Then I found it in a speciality kitchen store but the price was pretty high. I looked on Amazon and found it for a fraction of the cost. Bought it and love it. I almost want to open jars just to play with the thing. It works on everything....even milk jugs when your hand are wet. Sure beats trying to open a pickle jar with a wet towel!!
customer_reviews.author: Bob of Ozarks

customer_reviews.title: A tool that people having difficulty opening jars should buy!
customer_reviews.text: I was having difficulty opening jars lately and needed to get something to help. It adjusts to most every size jar and with the rubber handle it makes it very easy to open anything that I have opened, so far. Thank goodness! It's maddening to need something in a jar and you just can't get to it! Then you have to search for a human to help you open the almost welded lid. Not anymore. I can do it myself easily. This is a useful tool for the tool drawer in your kitchen along with the other kitchen gadgets.
customer_reviews.author: Texassews

customer_reviews.title: Bad product, sharp edges where you grab it.
customer_reviews.text: Very low quqlity, dangerously sharp edges where you grab it. Sadly, I missed the return deadline
customer_reviews.author: Alan S. Rosenberg

customer_reviews.title: I had heard such good comments about this jar opener
customer_reviews.text: I had heard such good comments about this jar opener, I bought one because getting jars open is my biggest problem. I was so excited to get it, and already had two jars I could not open, just waiting for this miracle tool. Imagine my disappointment when this tool did not work on either jar! A week later, I had a "new" jar to try, and this tool did work. I guess this is like everything. Sometimes it works, and other times it doesn't.
customer_reviews.author: Willow431

customer_reviews.title: Anyway it is an excellent jar opener
customer_reviews.text: My mother had one of these and I have wanted one for a long time--should have went right to AMAZON! Anyway it is an excellent jar opener, especially for those of us who have arthritis or other ailments that reduce our "hand strength". Easy to use, takes up little space, and easy to clean. My daughter in laws were so impressed I bought each one! Excellent addition to any kitchen.
customer_reviews.author: Doc Emma

customer_reviews.title: Simple ....and Perfect
customer_reviews.text: How much more simple a design could there be, yet this is probably the only jar opener that works first time and every time. This is a vast improvement over the more traditional openers, like rubber pads, and the devices that look like vise grips. This stores in a small space and is very easy to use. Probably deserves a place in MOMA.
customer_reviews.author: Michael B

customer_reviews.title: Finally, one that works!
customer_reviews.text: I had a severe stroke 3 years, plus I have arthritis and it was impossible to open some jars. I even bought one of those pricey ones that uses batteries which only was able to open ONE bottle in the six months I had it, before trashing it. I have no problem opening jars or tops with the Swing away.
customer_reviews.author: Wildwood Flower

customer_reviews.title: Older person approved
customer_reviews.text: Very helpful opening jars. especially wide lids for people with arthritis or tiny hands. As a side not, if you are visiting an older person, ask them if they need a jar opened. And reset that clock up near the kitchen ceiling for daylight saving will you? They shouldn't be on a step ladder!
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Burns

customer_reviews.title: Makes opening jars easy
customer_reviews.text: This is the easiest and sturdiest jar opener I have ever purchased or used. It is made of quality materials and adjusts easily to the size of the jar lid I need to open. I have arthritis in both hands and can still open my own jars with this tool. Best ever! I expect it to last many years.
customer_reviews.author: D. Weiskircher

customer_reviews.title: My late mother had one just like this, and it WORKED!
customer_reviews.text: I could never find a very good jar opener like my mom had, so for decades, I've gotten by with inferior devices /solutions. As one of my siblings "inherited" my mom's opener before I had a chance to lay claim to it, I continued to be out of luck, until I recently stumbled upon THIS one! I'm quite happy with my purchase. :)
customer_reviews.author: B. Rowland

customer_reviews.title: Nice product
customer_reviews.text: Very nice jar opener. Before ordering this one, I had ordered the plastic one that comes in an assortment of colors. What waste of money. I tried it on different sized jar lids with no success. ( had to resort to my old opener ) Exasperated, I finally threw this worthless piece of junk into the trash.bin. and ordered the Swing A Way.
customer_reviews.author: saltspray

customer_reviews.title: Uncomfortable to use
customer_reviews.text: This product was not versatile and was not comfortable in my hand. It also did not work well. There are better products out there.
customer_reviews.author: Patricia G

customer_reviews.title: Looks will deceive you.
customer_reviews.text: Looks kind of flimsy or cheap but damn this sucker works great. I’ve had a hard time opening things with my rheumatoid arthritis but this was so easy. I would suggest putting something like a towel on the lid if you don’t want it to scratch though but I can’t think of a scenario where you’d be worried about that.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley E. Hickson

customer_reviews.title: OUCH!
customer_reviews.text: For me, this was hard to use and it pinched the palm of my hand when it slipped and closed while I was trying to get a jar opened. On the other hand (no pun intended) it was easy for my husband to use and he never gets pinched. I think I just don't have enough strength to use it properly.
customer_reviews.author: Ladybug

customer_reviews.title: This device easily breaks the seal on the jar and makes it ...
customer_reviews.text: I buy Kuhne Garlic Barrel Pickles and the lids are so tight that it broke my electric jar opener. This device easily breaks the seal on the jar and makes it a breeze to open. America's Test Kitchen recommended it and I agree it's the best and requires very little effort to use.
customer_reviews.author: David L Workman

customer_reviews.title: Look no further - this is the one that works - especially for the elderly.
customer_reviews.text: I read a lot of reviews of other devices and this device before buying this one. First use was a large pickle jar. I squeezed and the vacuum released right away, and then I twisted off the lid with ease. Buy with confidence, and no batteries required!0)
customer_reviews.author: Lars

customer_reviews.title: Exactly like my mothers!
customer_reviews.text: I remember my mother having one of these when I was younger and as I continue to have more problems with my hands I found I needed to find something to help and this works perfectly. I bought a bunch of other gadgety things too just to make sure I could open everything but when everything arrived I realized that this was really the only one I will ever use. The cushioned handle is a bonus!
customer_reviews.author: Christine

customer_reviews.title: Finally, a jar opener I can use with my ...
customer_reviews.text: Finally, a jar opener I can use with my small hands! Even with his large hands, my husband now prefers to use "my" jar opener instead of the old wrench model because this one takes far less strength to use. At our age - we're both in our 70s - we really need that feature more than ever! In fact, with both these features, I would say that most children from about the age of 6 and up could open just about any jar with this handy gadget!
customer_reviews.author: Debbie Jordan, Peace Author

customer_reviews.title: Indispensable Opener
customer_reviews.text: As we get older, bottle and jars caps and lids seem to get tighter and tighter. At any rate, we found this opener to be so useful and affordable that we have half a dozen, scattered around the house and in the motor home, and we have given them to each of our children and many of our friends.
customer_reviews.author: Fuzzy Bear

customer_reviews.title: Awesome product
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my mom when I saw her using an electric lid opener that was extremely slow. I remembered seeing this one on the crazy Russian hacker's YouTube channel and figured I'd buy it for her. She now only uses this lid opener and has no trouble even with the hardest to open jars and bottles.
customer_reviews.author: Landon

customer_reviews.title: Works best if you have one weak hand and one strong
customer_reviews.text: I wanted and needed to love this- I have a ganglion cyst in my right wrist, and de Quervains tenosinovitis in both thumbs, and tendinitis in my wrists. But....this requires one good hand to hold the jar, and neither hand can grip the jar properly to get the torque I need to open the dang pasta sauce. I've managed to dent all the way around in my efforts, from squeezing this thing onto the lid, and still have no pasta sauce. Alas- I thought I had found a way to jar opening independence in the kitchen! Guess I will have to keep looking.
customer_reviews.author: Mary Wiser

customer_reviews.title: My Mom had one of these when I was growing up and I always missed it, now I have my own
customer_reviews.text: I remember using this when I was growing up, but I could never find one when I bought my own home. I saw it on Amazon and now can easily open jays and bottles. I also order some for my wife's care givers as gifts.
customer_reviews.author: D. at LLRC

customer_reviews.title: Old school is the best school.
customer_reviews.text: This works. It works on practically any jar. It works from afar. (well, not really). No Hercs. It is fully above par. This style of opener has been around for a long time. It is still "relevant," as these here young whippersnappers say. Stubborn jar - meet your master.
customer_reviews.author: MikeTX

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use, works well, and small storage profile
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE this type of jar opener! I don't know why everyone doesn't have one. It easily adjusts to fit any size lid and has a much smaller profile for storage than the big round type of jar openers. The range of size is really great, I've used it on milk jug lids and oversized glass jar lids.
customer_reviews.author: Laura Herlant

customer_reviews.title: Great when you don't have great grip!
customer_reviews.text: I have one of these and love it. My elderly Dad is having grip issues so I bought him one after hearing a story about not being able to open his pickle jar. It's a fantastic design and works great. He likes it!
customer_reviews.author: Bren

customer_reviews.title: This is a great jar opener
customer_reviews.text: This is a great jar opener. Super easy to open lids. Good quality and looks like it will last forever. One caveat it can put a slightl dent/crease on metal lids from the pressure when it grips the lidwhen you use it, it wont ruin the lid but if you use it on the same lid multiple times it could eventualy ruin the lid. So i dont use this on my fancy mason jars, just on ones i know ill be throwing away when they are empty.
customer_reviews.author: Ori Teper

customer_reviews.title: Super easy jar opener.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace a very old similar model that was my dear grandmother's. I misplaced hers and still haven't found it. Her's was at least 50 years old. Very simple style to operate and works perfectly. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: C. Schwarz

customer_reviews.title: The most used tool in my kitchen!
customer_reviews.text: I have one of these from 35 years ago. I think I inherited it from my grandmother, to be honest. I did not think they made these anymore, but they are the greatest kitchen tool. And the one I use most frequently in the kitchen. It opens any jar with ease. When my daughter-in-law was talking about a jar she couldn't get open, I decided I must try to locate one of these. Obviously, I found one. This is one of her Christmas gifts. It's an amazing tool. I have not found a jar I cannot open in 35 years!
customer_reviews.author: joanies

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful!!
customer_reviews.text: Wonderful!!!!! The ONLY jar opener that works! I've bought other brands/types in the past that were complete duds. My mom has had a Swing-A-Way for years and it works like a charm on everything. Finally got one for myself, so I can throw out all of the other imposters! Try it! You will love it!
customer_reviews.author: Angie Lewis

customer_reviews.title: I find this tool superior to some of the others I've been using for ...
customer_reviews.text: As a maturing lady who often needs help removing lids from jars and bottles, I find this tool superior to some of the others I've been using for years. It grips well and provides needed leverage to open most any jar or bottle. I happened to see it demonstrated on Dr. Oz's show. I'm very happy to have it in my kitchen!
customer_reviews.author: Joyful One

customer_reviews.title: It's the best  jar opener I have ever used, didn't know it was so easy to find on amazon.
customer_reviews.text: I had the same product when my youngest son was in selling things for school, he was about 13 and in the 7th grade, I purchased it, it was brass or cooper, how ever now he is 53, and mine wore out. I have tried all kinds of openers and noting really worked, when I saw this on amazon I ordered it immediately, it's the very best. I advise anyone who has trouble opening jars to get this opener.
customer_reviews.author: Linda P.

customer_reviews.title: Well-made, simple mechanics, the best ever.
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely the best jar opener I've ever used, and I've tried a lot. It adjust to fit everything from a large jar of salsa to a ketchup bottle. You do need to grip the handle firmly, but it gives excellent leverage. The only bottle I couldn't open was some half-used balsamic that had been in the cupboard for a decade. The cap was welded on so tight this tool actually tore the cap apart, with bits of it remaining stuck to the bottle.
customer_reviews.author: Baron Berwyn

customer_reviews.title: Great for most stubborn model paint bottles
customer_reviews.text: I have bottles of paint that have lids that get stuck with dried paint on them. This will usually (not always) free the caps from these bottles. I have some arthritis so this opener is a great help.
customer_reviews.author: JAMES JOHNSON

customer_reviews.title: Works on most lids.
customer_reviews.text: I've had numerous jar openers and this is the best I've had, although I can't make it work for me on everything. I have bad arthritis in my hands and with this jar opener, I can even open the small tops on juice bottles, fruit smoothies and bottled water. It works for me on peanut butter and applesauce but I can't get the kind of spaghetti sauce I use open with it. But, previous jar openers I've purchased didn't work for me on anything.
customer_reviews.author: Billie Chambers

customer_reviews.title: opening jars even my husband can't open!
customer_reviews.text: I love this jar opener! I had carpal tunnel in both hands and even after surgery have had reduced strength in my hands and often do not have someone around to help me open jars. This tool is amazing making opening jars simple, even opening jars my husband can't open!
customer_reviews.author: gma

customer_reviews.title: Works like a charm!
customer_reviews.text: My wife has a hard time opening jars because of her arthritis. This tool provides both the leverage and grip needed to open everything from a tiny 0.5oz model paint jar to mason jars and peanut butter. She absolutely loves it and uses it all the time.
customer_reviews.author: Dark Raven

customer_reviews.title: Handy item for your kitchen
customer_reviews.text: This will open just about any size jar from small water/soda bottles to large pickle jars with very little effort. I have one I like so much I got 4 for 4 different friends. They love them too.
customer_reviews.author: Miss MB

customer_reviews.title: Get a Grip
customer_reviews.text: Fantabulous jar opener that has cracked open every size of jar we have tried since we got this gem of a gizmo! No more running lids under hot water, no more whacking them with the handle of a table knife, no more trying to open them with all your might to no avail. The Swing-A-Way comfort grip jar opener is like a monkey wrench designed for your kitchen. For heaven's sake, just buy one and make your life easier.
customer_reviews.author: CardiCorgiCuties

customer_reviews.title: Best manual jar opener
customer_reviews.text: Best manual jar opener. Especially for larger jars like pickles and olives. What are you trying to prove struggling with jar tops. Opens jars too big for other openers but adjust for the other smaller sizes too.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Valentinetti

customer_reviews.title: greatest opener ever
customer_reviews.text: I have all kind of openers. I was looking for this one. The one I have now was my grandmother. Best opener you can have. Out of all the opener I have. My husband and I use this one the most. Don't think they made them any more. I saw a plastic one on TV that broke. This one is can with stand the test of time. You will not regret buying it.
customer_reviews.author: Carol A.

customer_reviews.title: Works on jar lids of numerous sizes. Great tool.
customer_reviews.text: This jar opener is perfect for larger size jar lids. I purchased it to fit some of the jars of items from Sam's and it fits perfectly and opens them effortlessly. Even very small soft drink 2 liter caps are easily opened with this tool. I highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: JW

customer_reviews.title: Best tool for hard to open jars
customer_reviews.text: Best tool for hard to open jars. Used to have one of these slightly larger. Glad I found one here. Works very well gives the leverage you need to open heart open cans and jars. Well, cans that have a twist top
customer_reviews.author: Torn

customer_reviews.title: I really like how this works
customer_reviews.text: I really like how this works! It is just *effortless*. The only caveat is just don’t squeeze too tight! It is a force multiplier and you may crack glass or squish plastic! And that is just how awesome this is-- everything is so easy to open to have to be careful about being too strong! lol! HULK LIKE! HULK NO SMASH!
customer_reviews.author: Robert Johnson

customer_reviews.title: This is the real thing...
customer_reviews.text: I purchased one lid remover which turned out to be a joke. This one's the real thing. I use it regularly for small and larger jar lid removal. Seems to be well made and should last for years.
customer_reviews.author: J. Peterson

customer_reviews.title: Better than I even hoped for.
customer_reviews.text: I have a bit of weakness in my hands now, and opening jars has become kind of a pain. This gadget makes it easy again, offering a good grip and proper leverage. Recommended highly.
customer_reviews.author: Jo MW

customer_reviews.title: Works Great!
customer_reviews.text: last jar opener I'll need! after my brother and I both tried to open a jug of laundry detergent I tried this - viola! easy and done in a flash! works well on everything I've tried. I'm so happy I heard about this! It did take a couple times to get the hang of it ...
customer_reviews.author: J Bird

customer_reviews.title: Truly amazing!!!
customer_reviews.text: A must have for every kitchen!! I saw this item on America's Test Kitchen and I trust their test results, but I couldn't believe how well this works!! After using, I immediately ordered one for my elderly parents and I will always include these in wedding shower gifts! It doesn't matter what kind of lid or the size, this opens it with minimal effort!
customer_reviews.author: Vanessa Elkins

customer_reviews.title: Opens any size jar, even small ones.
customer_reviews.text: Jars can be so difficult to open! Great product for opening any size jar, even small ones like Tabasco sauce. I have one that is 30 years old and it works great. I purchased these as gifts and they are the same great Swing-A-Way quality. They are made of metal and much better than the plastic ones ( which break.)
customer_reviews.author: tia

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: This works great. It opens all sizes and is very easy to use. I have not found a jar that it won't open. It is an essential for anyone that lives alone. Great design.
customer_reviews.author: Suecen

customer_reviews.title: Works for all sized lids
customer_reviews.text: I was struggling with opening jars and needed one that would work with small as well as large tops. This one is easy to adjust and works every time. Glad I found it.
customer_reviews.author: Teacup

customer_reviews.title: Hard to use and a little on the flimsy side.
customer_reviews.text: Hard to use and a little on the flimsy side. My mother had one of these when I was small. I was very impress with it then but not so now. This one is too light weight and loose to use
customer_reviews.author: azhirise

customer_reviews.title: Wow, it's open!
customer_reviews.text: This jar opener is so easy to use and should be in everyone's kitchen. I have less grip power in my hands due to MS and I am able to open jars easily using the Swing-A-Way Comfort Grip Jar Opener. This would make a great stocking stuffer for adult children who don't have one!
customer_reviews.author: Nicola

customer_reviews.title: Apparently a previously used product
customer_reviews.text: Product arrived in unsealed plastic bag Appeared to have been used previously Not sturdy and tight as a new product should/would be Returned for refund May try another purchase of same product at a later date
customer_reviews.author: Janet D.

customer_reviews.title: Best jar opener I have tried
customer_reviews.text: Great tool. I have tried many devices for opening jars and this is the only one I have been satisfied with. I have had 2 shoulder surgeries recently and this is great.
customer_reviews.author: BR from indiana

customer_reviews.title: BEST JAR OPENER EVER
customer_reviews.text: Grew up having one of these in the house. BEST JAR OPENER EVER. It opens anything you can imagine. I was so excited when I ran across this listing never thought I would find one!
customer_reviews.author: Rease leia

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use!
customer_reviews.text: My mother had one similar to this one when I was growing up and it was great for opening jars! I thought about it about a month ago and decided to look I’m Amazon and lo and behold, I found it. It is not made of the same strong metal as the one my mother had, but it certainly does the trick!
customer_reviews.author: Shiela

customer_reviews.title: Loved it enough that I gifted 5 at Christmas!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered several styles of jar openers but found this to be my favorite adjusting to very small jar lids all the way to large. It does not require you to hold it a specific way and then slip as some of the others require.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Jar Opener, but be careful to use it properly
customer_reviews.text: Works well to open most jars, from small to large. Be careful to use a firm grip, but do not squeeze too hard. If it slips, you can pinch your fingers.
customer_reviews.author: Raymond Smith

customer_reviews.title: Great for arm impairment.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because I had trouble opening things after shoulder surgery. I was tired of handing things to my wife to open. This worked great and opens a wide variety of lids. Helped restore my masculine pride while recovering.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: must have for sore hands
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a gift after finding it on amazon. I have a very old one made just the same way and didn't realize they were still made. If you have arthritis, or other difficulty with opening jars, this is the inexpensive, easy to use answer.
customer_reviews.author: Janet/ Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Definately the "Cat's Meow"
customer_reviews.text: I'm getting older and developing some arthritis in my hands, and this Jar Opener is a tremendous help. My parents had an opener like this when I was a kid, but I couldn't find a new one at any of the stores I frequent locally. This is very easy to use, fits jars of all sizes and really increases my leverage when I need to open a jar that is packed under pressure. I do some home canning, and this opener is essential for opening jars that are hot-packed. The design is exceedingly simple, the quality appears good and I expect this opener to basically last forever.
customer_reviews.author: MT

customer_reviews.title: Not the Swing-A-Way Quality I once knew
customer_reviews.text: I have owned a Swing-A-Way manual can opener for over 30 years and it has worked flawlessly. This Jar opener is another story. During it's first use the black handle constantly slipped off while trying to grip the jar lid. After using the opener I rinsed it under warm water dried it and placed it in the dish drainer. The next day I noticed rust spots on the jar opener. After just one use? The opener also came with labels/stickers that were near impossible to remove. This is just not the quality I had hoped for from Swing-A-Way.
customer_reviews.author: S.P.

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money
customer_reviews.text: I've only been able to successfully open 1 of 10 jars I tried this on. Slips off the lid & nicks my hand every time.
customer_reviews.author: en

customer_reviews.title: works well
customer_reviews.text: I debated between this and some other models but am happy I chose this one. It is easy to use on a variety of jar lids. It has enough leverage that it doesn't take a lot of strength to open most jars.
customer_reviews.author: GEW

customer_reviews.title: The best Jar opener of all. Inelegant, inexpensive, the best!
customer_reviews.text: Over time, I have bought over a dozen of these. Give one to a fried and he/she/ will never forget you! And often will say thank you to you years later. Thank you Ruthie. You gave me the one I'm still using. That was 30 years ago.
customer_reviews.author: Dedicated reader

customer_reviews.title: More effective than you might think
customer_reviews.text: After a recent hand injury, opening anything with a screw top was painful. Even holding a bottle in the injured hand was painful. This little gadget solved my problem
customer_reviews.author: Sybil's friend

customer_reviews.title: Amazing product
customer_reviews.text: Amazing! This product is simple to use and does absolutely everything you want it to do. I would give it 10 stars if I could. I have some arthritis in my dominant hand and find it hard to open most jars. It literally takes seconds with this opener. I have used it to open screw top wine bottles as well as much larger jars of jam, sauce, etc. The opener takes up almost no space in the drawer and the price is reasonable. Can't say enough good things about it.
customer_reviews.author: VJ Boston

customer_reviews.title: This item is not made in the USA.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this particular product specifically because I was foolish not to read other comments about it, other than the one that said that it was manufactured in the USA. I did not want to purchase item that was made anywhere else but in America (or perhaps England or Germany). I do not consider an item to be made in the USA when it is merely distributed by a company with offices in the USA. Such items made in China are notoriously short lived. I would have paid more for the Item, if necessary, if it were made in the USA.
customer_reviews.author: Michael B

customer_reviews.title: Great help for achy hands
customer_reviews.text: With arthritis plaguing my hands, it’s getting harder and harder for me to open jars and bottles. This has made a huge difference for the better. Great product and so easy to use. Fits smallest to largest tops.
customer_reviews.author: MemaT

customer_reviews.title: We Haven't Met a Lid This One Can't Open
customer_reviews.text: You know, this is a simple kitchen tool that is well designed and works as advertised. Do keep in mind, though, that one has to have a functional hand grip in order to use this opener. Having two functional hand grips makes it quite easy to use. Using this design of lid opener on a glass container is not without its risks, though, so be careful. We often wrap a glass jar in a thick towel and do the lid opening in the sink in case the glass should break. So far, none have done so in our use of this opener......
customer_reviews.author: Don M.

customer_reviews.title: Lasts for years!
customer_reviews.text: Great product, I’ve had these for years, had kept one in my office st work, bought one of these from Amazon for my parents and an extra one for me here st home!!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Does a Great Job!
customer_reviews.text: This works much better than I expected it to. I'm getting older and don't have as much strength in my hands anymore and this little gadget has worked like a charm opening stubborn bottles and jars. Gives me just enough leverage to open things with ease.
customer_reviews.author: SRL

customer_reviews.title: Good to go
customer_reviews.text: I needed to open a bottle of iced tea. These are easy to adjust and use. The one I had kept slipping but these held tight.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Herbst

customer_reviews.title: Works every time!
customer_reviews.text: Opens jars so easily. It's very convenient to have around. The only drawback is that it's a little awkward to fit it on the jar lid sometimes because it slides back and forth to open wider/smaller. Once you get it on and tighten it up it's fine. It makes opening jars a piece of cake. You don't have to use much force at all which is great for persons with grip issues.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I really wanted this to work!
customer_reviews.text: I have a jar that I can't open. I ordered a rubber grip circle from Amazon. While it works on some items, it wouldn't open the jar. I was so hoping this item would open it. Sadly, it didn't work. I'll try one more item from Amazon. I'd really like to find something that works!
customer_reviews.author: Ginger

customer_reviews.title: AWESOME!
customer_reviews.text: I’ve always had problems opening jars. I have no hand strength. This tool is great. It makes it so easy to open jars. You just squeeze handle to fit the size of the lid & turn. Lid pops right open. I use it all the time. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: S.D.

customer_reviews.title: works!
customer_reviews.text: Really works. Bought this one for a friend with hand arthritis issues. Previously purchased this item for almost everyone in our family.
customer_reviews.author: Red

customer_reviews.title: A reliable jar opener
customer_reviews.text: Some things shouldn't change. This has been a great devise for many years. A great gift to give to persons who have diminished hand and wrist strength. Gifted them many times.
customer_reviews.author: Richard R Crittenden

customer_reviews.title: thumbs up
customer_reviews.text: As I am aging I wanted to get something that I could use for a Long time. The jar opener makes short work of every jar.
customer_reviews.author: mpoppen

customer_reviews.title: Best opener EVER!
customer_reviews.text: I saw this on America's Test Kitchen and had to get it. It is just the best opener for someone with arthritis or lack of strength. This purchase was actually my second one because I wanted one to pack into my travel bag. It works on all sizes of jars and bottles. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Ronni Land

customer_reviews.title: Gifted to friend with weak hands
customer_reviews.text: My friend thanked me again for gifting her with this bottle/jar opener. She had used mine, loved it, so I surprised her with one of her own. A real winner.
customer_reviews.author: Nicky

customer_reviews.title: Amazing!
customer_reviews.text: I bought one of these for opening tough jars. My mom saw it and tried it out and she loved it so much that she stole it. So I ordered two more to replace mine and have a backup. The opener is super easy to squeee tight then turn to release the lid.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Goad

product_meta.title: Swing-A-Way Comfort Grip Jar Opener, Black, 9-Inch -
product_meta.description: Style Name:Jar OpenerSince 1938, Swing A Way has created the highest quality, most dependable can openers on the market. When you reach for a Swing A Way, you reach for a classic. Soon to become one of your go to kitchen gadgets, this Comfort Grip Jar Opener is a must have! Easily open stubborn jars lids and caps with leveraged twisting and spring loaded power for smooth, easy operation. This opener adjusts to fit most food lids, jar lids and more. Extremely durable with an all steel construction. Features an ergonomic, soft cushion grip for comfortable handling; will fit any size hands. This jar opener is perfect for anyone but ideal for arthritis and seniors. Hand wash when needed with warm water and a mild detergent, rinse and dry immediately. Measures 7.5 inches.
feature_bullets: OPEN JARS EASILY: This jar opener assists and can easily open stubborn jar lids and caps; adjusts to fit most sizes
SMOOTH AND EASY TO USE: This jar opener provides leveraged twisting and spring loaded power for smooth, easy operation
ALL STEEL CONSTRUCTION: This can opener is extremely durable with an all steel construction
COMFORTABLE GRIP: Soft cushion grips for comfortable handling; ergonomic handles fit any size hands
EASY TO CLEAN: Hand wash when needed with warm water and a mild detergent, rinse and dry immediately; measures 7.5 inches

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Item can be shipped within U.S.
specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S. Learn More
